title: Bedtime Mode not turning off on schedule?
content:
First of all, this used to not be the case. Bedtime Mode has worked perfectly in these settings until a couple months ago.

As you see in the screenshots, I have it set for "While charging at bedtime." This timeframe is 11:00pm-5:00am. That used to be no issue, but now, Bedtime Mode just won't turn off automatically. 5am will pass and my phone will still be in Bedtime Mode, with the notification!

How is this possible? And why did it just start happening? Check the screenshots to see that it's not within the timeframe, and the notification says "Bedtime Mode is on." Even though the screenshot couldn't capture this, grayscale was also still on.

I shouldn't have to stop charging my phone to turn off bedtime mode should I? I feel like that defeats the purpose of having a time frame set.

title: Pixel 4a Stuck on white "Google" screen
content:
I had recently joined the Android 12 Beta Program and installed Android 12 on my Pixel (The first Beta release), I really liked it but regrettably I had to go back to Android 11, because an app (DJI Fly) simply wouldn't work on the Android 12 Beta.
So I un-enlisted my device and got the notification, that I could go back to Android 11. I backed up everything (it said that I would loose all data on the phone), then I downloaded the update, but I didn't restart my device, I wanted to do that in the morning, in case I had issues.
Long story short the next morning I woke up and my Pixel was dead (the battery had ran out), I plugged it in to the charger and waited a bit. After 5 minutes i long pressed the Power button, and my Pixel turned on, the white screen with the "Google" logo appeared, as per usual. But then it didn't go away. I waited for an hour or more. I tried to go to the fastboot menu (which worked) and tried every option there. NO MATTER WHAT I DID, MY PHONE WOULD GET STUCK ON THE WHITE SCREEN WITH THE GOOGLE LOGO.
I really need my phone, and I hope this can be fixed. I would prefer to fix it myself, as I bought the phone via Amazon UK, because Google doesn't have a shop in Slovenia, where I live. So I imagine sending it back would be a hassle.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 4a

title: Pixel Device Activation Issues On Sprint, 3 Weeks Of Problems.
content:
This has been a long ongoing issue for three weeks now, and I can provide more details if necessary, but the gist of it is that my Pixel device simply will not activate on my Sprint account. 

I have owned multiple Pixel devices ever since 2017, and I've had zero issues with activation before. I've utilized both physical SIM cards and the ESIMs before, all without issues.

However, three weeks ago I went to activate my new Pixel, as my previous one that I just activated in April of this year was badly damaged. The damaged device was activated via physical SIM, as Sprint decided to send me one, and that activation took about five minutes total in order to be successful. Yet, I received an error on Sprint's website when attempting to activate my new Pixel. I called in to customer service, and they explained that somehow both my old and new Pixels were active on my line at the same time. Hence, their system messed up during the activation process.

They claimed they would clear this up, yet the new Pixel is still refusing to activate despite clearly showing compatibility on their BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) query. They are receiving a "trace error" in the system, which contradicts their initial successful BYOD check.

While speaking with technical support yesterday, they claimed that if my device still isn't working after Monday then I should return it to Google.

I've never had this problem before, but the technician claims they've run into this numerous times before with phones from "third parties", including Google. Obviously, there's no reason why a Google phone shouldn't work with Sprint, either via ESIM or a physical SIM card, and I'm honestly wondering why this is even an issue.

If this latest support ticket doesn't fix the issue via Sprint, then I'm honestly at a loss for what I can do anymore. Nothing is making sense here, and there's certainly no reason for why my Google device should have to be returned.

I'm simply looking for advice and guidance here as to what my next steps should be, and whether any of what I have so far been told makes any sense or sounds accurate.

Thanks.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 3

Thanks

title: Welcome screen stuck on Copy Apps and Data Page on Android 12
content:
The Welcome Screen is stuck on Copy apps and data section after factory reset, if I choose don't copy, it asks me to enter the earlier passcode, which I do, and then it goes back to the Copy Apps & data section and the loop goes on.

---

I applied for the Android 12 beta program, and everything was working perfectly for about 3 weeks. Recently when switching to the recent apps menu, the phone froze, and a message stating that the Pixel Launcher had stopped working error message popped up, restarted the phone, and the error popped up again until eventually stating that a factory reset was necessary, so I went ahead.

But now, the error I have stated is not letting me go on and activate my device. My Pixel is connected to the Internet and the system language has been selected. It is only when is select "Don't Copy" on the Copy Apps and data section, when is asks me to enter the earlier passcode or login with Google. When I go ahead, it takes me back to the Copy Apps & data section and the loop goes on.

I feel this is an Android 12 bug, and I'm wanting to leave the beta as well, but I cannot unless I set up the phone, which is exactly what I cannot do. 

I've sideloading Android 11, but that won't work since that is an older version of Android. I've also restarted the phone several times and didn't not work.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 4a (5G)

title: Smart Lock "Trusted places" not working
content:
I am trying to use Smart Lock to keep my device unlocked at home.  'Trusted places' setup appears normal but does not keep the device unlocked.  'On-body detection' and 'Trusted devices' are working properly but not useful in my application.  My location shows accurately in Google Maps and Google Earth.  Things I have already tried include changing the Home label and changing it back again, deleting and re-adding the Trusted place, using the current location as a Trusted place, using only a single Google account on the device, Wipe cache partition, reset app preferences, confirming that Google and Maps have location access allowed all the time.

I also have a Samsung Galaxy Tab A7 (using the same Google account) that has the same issue.  My friend has a Pixel 4a (5G) and a Samsung Galaxy Tab A7 (using a different Google account); both also have the same issue.

Edit:

I did some additional testing from a location a few miles from home.  I set it as Trusted, but the phone will not stay unlocked, even without moving it at all.

Also, I attempted to set Home as Trusted on an old Moto G5 Plus running Android 8.1.0.  This also failed, even though it had worked at one time.

So, I believe that I have ruled out the device, the OS version, the specific location, a general problem with Smart Lock, trouble determining the current location, and permissions.

My guess is that 'Trusted places' has somehow been disabled for my Google account, but my friend has the same issue and there is a similar post today
https://support.google.com/pixelphone/thread/110904280/smart-lock-is-not-working

I'm out of ideas.  Please help.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 4a (5G)

title: Control over own phone: Google Pixel vs. Samsung Galaxy
content:
I am a Samsung Galaxy user who has gotten increasingly mad at Samsung over years about the phone doing more and more its own thing without me as the owner having any control.

[TINY RANT START] The last drop was when I was getting daily notifications to migrate from Samsung Cloud to One Drive, even though I had nothing in Samsung Cloud, nor I wanted to have to do anything with either of them. The notifications were saying they would end from March 31. Nopes, in April that got an extension to April 30. Disabling those things from pinging me daily was a disabled option in the settings. So that's it, I decided that I needed to move off somewhere where I get more control. [TINY RANT END].

Here, I would like to ask and get answers about a few basics about Google Pixel, as I consider getting the Google Pixel 6 later this year. Please, go sensitive about the below things, as they had been quite some pain points for me in the last few years:

Sometime in 2017/18, Samsung Galaxies started randomly requiring pin check to unlock instead of biometrics, for security purposes they say. One would argue that this wasn't random, but that's how it feels to me. Does Google Pixel enforce things like that, or can the user set up to always unlock the phone with biometrics, and only need a pin verification when the biometric check fails enough times? That's a selling point for me.
Sometime in 2019, some parts of Samsung Health didn't want to work anymore without having access to my contact list. That was when I emptied my contact list in order to use all of the Samsung Health. Does Google Fit exercise similar behavior?
Also, Galaxy Store started requiring access to my contact list in order to update the apps. That is just bonkers, but luckily I had already wiped my contact list and the phone remained 'functional' in the sense that Samsung apps could get an update. Does Google Pixel exercise any similar behavior of asking for unreasonable things (e.g., my contact list) in order to provide basic functionality, such as updating the apps?
Sometime in 2021, Samsung Health didn't want to work anymore without 2FA. That is how I lost access to my Samsung Health. Does Google Fit do the same? In general, how is enforcing 2FA bad at Google Pixel? A phone that lets me choose 2FA or not is a selling point.

Hope this wasn't too painful to read. Thanks in advance for telling me how those points work out on Google Pixel!
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device

title: Google alarm music changes to sound/tone
content: I've been using the music alarm feature of the Google clock app for several months now. It was great and would play whatever song I selected, plus continue with more music if it was an album or a single song selected. title: Missed Alarms Don't Repeat After Snoozing
content:

Case experiences
When alarm is triggered and manually snoozed, it works as intended with the next alarm five minutes later.
When alarm is triggered and rings for one minute, the alarm stops and notification of "Missed alarm" is displayed and no further alarms are triggered, which is not as intended, even after five minutes or later after that first alarm.

Is there a setting to have the Clock application's missed alarms continue ringing per the setting's snooze period as if manually snoozed?

Thanks.

title: English (Ireland) Keyboard
content: When I compose an email in Gmail on my new Pixel 4A 5G the default currency symbol is £.  I need to hold the £ key and select the € symbol every time I need to use euros in an email which is pretty much all the time!  My language is set to English (Ireland).  I have two keyboard languages installed:  Irish QWERTY and English (UK) QWERTY - there is no English (Ireland) keyboard option available.  If I select Irish Qwerty from within the app the currency defaults to € but the keyboard is set for Gaeilge which is not helpful if I want to write in English.  I usually have the keyboard set to English (UK) QWERTY which allows me write in English but the currency defaults to £!  This affects nearly everyone in Ireland!  The only solution is for google to make an English (Ireland) keyboard available.  Microsoft does this why not google?

title: How to disable developer-hubris features and unwanted behaviour
content:
Started out just looking for a way to make sure volume buttons on the phone only control media volume instead of constantly but not consistently muting notifications.

Google help pages describe this glitch/bug/issue but without a suggested solution:
"When you press a volume button, the volume that changes depends on what you're doing. For example, if you're watching a movie, the movie volume changes. If you press your volume buttons when you're not listening to anything, your media volume changes."

Besides the obvious mistake that movie volume and media volume are the same thing... 🤦🏼
It seems to be saying there is a glitch that causes the OS to exhibit unwanted behaviours in the form of "developer-hubris" features that try to guess what I want the device to do instead of what I was telling it to do.

Any way to disable this unwanted-behaviour-generating algorithm?
Or at the very least is there a way to set the volume keys to only mute media volume and not proactively disable notifications?
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 4a

title: Issue with built-in native notification audio effects of apps
content:
Hi,

Many Android apps come with their own notification audio effects, for example the eBay Cha-Ching notification sound when you've sold something.

But on my Pixel 4a 5G, apparently not a single app plays its supplied sound effects, instead all apps are using default audio effects from the notification sound pool provided by the Pixel itself.

This means that I can no longer hear from a distance which app is asking for attention, since everything sounds the same now, which means I have to physically unlock the phone and check notifications.

I can't find a way to activate the app's built-in audio effects. I can assign downloaded sound effects to apps and their different notification types, but that would be very time-consuming and tedious.

My older Android devices do play these distinct notifications sound just fine, so how can I fix this on my new Pixel?

Thanks in advance for any tipps!

title: App Drawer - no way to personalize it? Are you kidding me?
content:
Hi, I've just bought a Pixel 5 and I could never imagine this level device could have this kind of non sense - is there really NO WAY to organize my app drawer? I mean I have A LOT of apps I use and the most convenient way I found throughout the years is definitely having main apps on the main screen and the rest organized using folder on the so called app drawer. Why it's not an option on Pixel? 

Also, I've tried different launchers which might safe the day, but there's another flaw (and I found a lot on this, seems like Google simply refuses to fix it) - any 3rd party launcher loses its snappiness and there's a delay between going back to main screen and opening an app.

Come on guys, you take away an opportunity to use a 3rd party launcher but at the same time refuse to fix what I believe is the most common reason for one - not being able to organize my phone the way I like.

And if there's a way to work around this, I would love to know it and would highly appreciate any help, cheers!

title: Quick app switching by swiping HOME button on Pixel 4a 5G is not supported
content:
I have a very VERY specific question about the Pixel 4a 5G.
I already got it and I love using it, but I have something that makes it hard to get used to, compared to my prior Pixel 3 XL.

Under the phone's Settings -> System -> Gestures -> System Navigation
There are two options... the new "Gesture Navigation", and the legacy "3-button Navigation".

I love, and always will, the "3-button Navigation".
But the Pixel 4a 5G lost a VERY crucial feature with that 3-button Navigation.
I can no longer swipe left and right to quickly switch back-and-forth between recent apps.
And that swiping feature is available in the "Gesture Navigation" option.
So, why does the 3-button Navigation not have it?

Is there something I can do?
If not, what can i do to request that feature inclusion?

PLEASE GIVE ME GOOD NEWS!
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 4a (5G)

Having just received a software update I thought I would go and try again - so I go to Settings > Accounts > Add account and in the list there is an new account type "Office" with a Microsoft Office-like logo, thought I would give it a try, I tap it and the screen shifts around a little then goes back to the list of accounts and now I have an entry "Office" with type "Office" - I didn't have to provide any account details or anything. So now I tap it and it tells me "Sync off for all items" but I cannot change that.

What is this account type and has it got anything to do with being able to access my Hotmail calendar from the Google calendar app?

title: Pixel to Pixel migration (same model)
content:
Google has replaced a VERY badly performing 4a with, yet another 4a:
so the straight usbc to usb c cable SUPPLIED in the box does not work?
(requires additional 'permissions' but these are non existent in andriod 11)

Now using an former usb A to usb C cable AND the 'switch adapter' supplied in the box, and finally both handsets see each other;
 however :
the new handset is stuck on "Getting Account Info" (circle of death) for over half an hour now
the (former) handset is stuck on "Connected to new handset preparing....."
-is there ANY indication how long this (may) take ?
ok given files sizes this would not be an exact science, but roughly... ?
Why is there NO OTHER progress indication.. should I wait, Should I kill the process?????

This 'seamless' transfer from TWO phones of the SAME GOOGLE model is a real let down.

RESOLVED: had to REMOVE the cable, this FORCED a reboot and then the two phones continued correctly the set up in a few (5) minutes: not this ALSO meant the supplied straight usbC - usbC cable then miraculously worked as well?
Very strange, but finally worked.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 4a

title: Switching From a Pixel Phone to a Different Android Phone
content:
Very soon I will be switching from a Google Pixel phone to a different brand Android phone. I'm looking for advice on my plan to migrate all my apps, settings and data from the Pixel to the new Android phone.

I have removed all personal files  -- photos, music, documents of all types, wallpapers and ringtones - from the Pixel phone; they are backed up to my Google Drive.
I have backed up everything that Android makes it possible to backup.
I have separately backed up all calls and messages from all such apps.

It seems to me that all I need to do on the new Android phone is to sign in to my Google account, which will recreate everything on the new phone, and then restore my backups, and I am done.

Will this successfully migrate me to the new phone?
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel

title: Messages not changing default notification ring
content:
I have a Pixel 5 that is fully updated. I cannot change the default ringtone for the Messages app to be different than every other notification that relies on the default notification sound. This is repeatable on two different Pixel 5 phones. I have cleared the cache and storage and tried again with the same issue occurring.
Long press on Messages icon
Press "i" in the upper right corner of the menu
Press "Notifications" in Messages App Info page
Press "Incoming messages" button
Press "Advanced" button (why it requires another button press to get to the sound is beyond me; poor UI design)
Press "Sound" button
Choose new sound and press "Save" button
Go back to "Messages" and ask a friend to send you a message and the same default ringtone still sounds
I'd love to know what I'm doing wrong.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 5

title: Finish Signing in to continue will not open the authenticator
content:
The issue I'm having is that all accounts from my business domain (which I have imported to google so they function like google accounts) will not sync. All my personal google accounts have synced. I have checked the Google Admin portal for the business domain and have approved and confirmed all sign-in attempts from this new device. 

I have left it overnight.

I tried turning off and on again 2 step verification. 

The device (pixel 4a) is not showing up as connected on the list of devices in the domain administrator settings for all domain accounts but it is showing as connected in the device list of each individual account when I log into them individually on the tablet. 

On the phone itself:
Settings>Accounts>*select account*>Google Account 
This loads with a "Finish signing in to continue: Something went wrong and you need to sign in again. Sign in. (with hyperlink)"

When I click 'Sign in' It struggles and fails to open the authenticator.

My "Find my phone' is disabled.

The option to 'generate a security code' via google play services says 'there was a problem generating a security code'.

I really am at a loss and do not want to factory reset again. I should not have to to solve this issue.

Thank you for your input.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 4a (5G)

title: Google Authenticator on New Phone w/ Security Keys
content:
How do you set up Google Authenticator when you also have security keys?
I got a replacement phone and nearly have it all set up- the old phone is inoperable so no help in the process. I have two physical security keys for my google account (both bluetooth and USB), which worked fine. For my social media, I had been using Google Authenticator to produce codes to log in. However, the Authenticator app is now wiped clean and I cannot get any codes to log into my social media. 
I've followed all the steps online- go to the google account, follow to security, 2-factor, and there should be a section for the Authenticator where I can set it up. However, when I get to the 2 factor section, all that appears are my security keys and the options to install more of them. 
I have also tried: - uninstalling and reinstalling the app - just adding the social media accounts again (no can do) -trying to get into accounts without codes (you have to send a special message to facebook etc.)
To summarize: I use Google Authenticator to provide 2 factor authentication for social media log in. I am now logged out of my social media accounts and unable to log back in because the Authenticator has not transferred to the new phone, and cannot provide me any codes.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 3

title: Strange UI behavior for wallpaper selection
content:
Say I want to change my lock screen wallpaper. I open settings, choose styles & wallpers, swipe right to chose the lock screen preview. I then click one of the options, then, for some inexplicable reason, lock screen preview disappears and is replaced with the home screen.  I must select "Lock screen" at the top.  This will be the second time selecting this option for one task. OK, so I like it. I click the check mark, now it's giving me the option to set it as my home screen, lock screen, or both.  So, again I'm being given more options than I want as a user.  I just want to change my lock screen.  

The last choice is nothing new, but the behavior before that is a bit goofy. I was legitimately confused when I selected a wallpaper for my lock screen when the home screen preview popped up. Not intuitive.

Google, maybe sort this out in your next update?

title: Help: Pixel XL boot looping
content:
My mom has a Pixel XL device, and recently it started to boot loop.
In the beginning it says "Your Device Cannot Be Checked for Corruption" and then it shows Google logo for a few seconds and then restarts.

I succeeded reaching bootloader mode using power-button and volume-down-key, but when I choose to go to recovery mode it just starts to boot to the OS instead.

I tried to re-flash the firmware (from here ) , while removing the `-w` part (to avoid wiping, as I want to recover the data even if I will do factory-reset), but it still reached boot-loop (despite seeing that it flashed fine).

Talking with some smarphones-lab (without letting them check it out yet), they said that many times a boot loop is a hardware issue (the CPU, meaning the SOC ), and that if that's the issue, there is no way to restore anything.

Is it true?
How can I fix this and also restore the data? Some of the things on the device didn't get a backup for some reason (for a long time), including for Google Photos.

Please help
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel

This happened to me when I was using the Pixel 2 XL years ago, then the Pixel 3 XL, now the Pixel 4 XL .. with no definite solution at hand.

Toggling between networks, toggling airplane mode, device reboot, all the jazz. Never once seen this feature work. Even after 2hrs of inactivity letting it run in the background - which I'm pretty confident it's not running at all, given there's absolutely no way to see progress of any sort.

The only way is either to flash manually or via pixel tool, either way, both requires me to be at home and I'm mostly working. And not everyone has access to adb 24/7. What if there's a critical patch that needs to be pushed? 

Does anyone have a solution? Tried and tested?

Not using the device update OTA feature altogether seems to be the most popular "solution", which doesn't really fix things to begin with, rather, it avoids the broken feature altogether.

I hope mandatory manual flashing isn't gonna be a thing for the next 3-5 years with no end in sight. I think it's only reasonable to expect a basic, core function to work flawlessly. Because no other phones have this issue and I change my secondary every year between different brands. I seem to experience this only on Pixels for the last 3yrs.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 4 XL

title: Can't turn off sound for "missed call" notification
content:
New problem that just showed up in the last day or so on my Pixel 3 with Android 11:

It plays a sound every time there's a "missed notification" call. I get a lot of these because of spam callers. The phone isn't ringing or anything because I have it set to screen them. I just get a "missed call" notification out of the blue, and a distracting sound. It sounds like the same sound used for "low battery" notifications.

When I slide the notification to the side and click on the gear, it says "These notifications can't be modified":

I can go into the notification settings and go into the detailed settings for "Missed calls":

 
"Sound: None" would seem to imply that it should play no sound.

Earlier today the Vibration switch was on, but I wasn't getting vibrations with these notifications. I turned it off, and still get the sound.

The "Silent" button at the top is disabled.

It's also not possible to disable all phone notifications, if I go back out one level from this screen.

I've looked at settings within the Phone app, and can't find anything relevant, except I guess "Ring & notification volume" (I don't want to silence phone rings all the time) and "Do Not Disturb" (same). There's a "Default notification sound", but that's set to a completely different sound than the one I'm getting.

Getting pretty annoyed by this. I'm guessing it's just a bug.

title: Pixel 2 to Pixel 5 Migration
content:
Now that the Pixel 2 is no longer receiving updates, I'm about to purchase a Pixel 5 and would like to minimize the inconvenience of migrating from the Pixel 2 to the Pixel 5. To be clear, I have read the canned Google instructions on transferring data from and Android Phone to a Pixel, but have more specific questions.

There has been some chatter in the blogs about glitches occurring when migrating using a wired connection between old phone and a Pixel 5. Is it safer to migrate using the Pixel Cloud backup (even if slower), and if so, how is this done? Is it safer still to start fresh on the new phone and manually reinstall Account and Apps? (If it matters: the Accounts, Apps, and the organization of the Apps in groups is all I want to transfer; there are no other data on my phone as everything is in the cloud). 
Assuming that I will use the wire, am I correct that the Quick Switch Adapter talked about in the canned Google procedures is nothing more than a USB-A to USB-C adapter and so I can use instead a USB-C to USB-C cable?

Thanks in advance.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 5

title: Android phone - Can I start/stop needed apps by logging in as a primary/secondary user?
content:
The goal is to separate the activity of the apps I use for work from the personal use of the smartphone.

Specifically, I am looking for ways to shut down the apps completely, when I don't want to use them and more importantly to stop all of their "background" activities. When there is a whole bunch of apps, each with a load of "permissions" (including things like location tracking "at all times"), It is not practical to go over permission settings for each of them in the evening and in the morning.

The idea I had, was to just create a second user on my Android phone and activate the apps I want to use, only while logged in as such a second user. Can this work? Will the apps shut off completely (in the same way as if I power off the phone) when I log out of such a second user account and log back in as a primary user?

Any advice, any other recommendations to achieve the goal?
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 5

title: Why are the accessibility settings on the PIxel 4a5g so terrible?
content:
I am so frustrated. I just ordered the Pixel 4a 5g for the larger screen. I had a Samsung Galaxy 9 and I thought the larger screen on the 4a 5g would make the font sizes even larger. I am visually impaired so this is very important to me. 
I set up my new phone with the largest font sizes and everything is significantly smaller than my old phone. I am so disappointed. I can't change the size in messenger. My apps all look the same. The font is laughable. How is this accessible? Did the developers even work with someone who's visually impaired to see if it's well designed? I wonder how terrible the accessibility is for people with other disabilities. 
I've honestly never been an iPhone or Apple user, but the thoughtlessness of the design of this phone means I'll be returning this to finally get an iPhone since apparently they're they best in the game when it comes to accessibility. STEP IT UP GOOGLE!

title: How to escalate my case for Pixel 4 XL device issue
content:
Hi, I have a Pixel 4 XL that recently started giving me issues with face recognition (I realised that there have been may other similar community posts about this issue due to an issue with the last system update). After reaching out to support team and following all their steps (including the final step of doing a factory reset) the problem still remained and the team finally conveyed the phone can be replaced.
Now I have been given an RMA and I have ordered the replacement phone but I realised I have been charged $1267  (as a hold amount) - which is the price of a brand new Pixel 4 XL - while I would be getting a refurbished phone as a replacement.

I tried several time to call up the support team to explain that I should not be charged the full price of the phone (it should either be a reduced price or I should be given a brand new phone as a replacement) - even though the price is technically a block which would be released. However, in a situation where if a customer is not able to return the phone (due to any reason) then Google would be charging the price of a brand new phone for a refurbished device which is not correct.

My multiple attempts to call the support team have just resulted in me being on hold for nearly an hour with someone eventually 'promising' that someone will get back and email the response - but till date no one has bothered to reply.

Is there anyway to escalate a grievance related to a Google Pixel? I am not sure why Google has made it so hard for customers to not find ways to escalate complaints/grievances (the only options that we can find is writing these issues on community forums or restarting the process of reaching out to support team again.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 4 XL

title: Pixel 5 Unable to activate phone
content:
Hallo,
Today I received a brand new Pixel 5. After charging it to 100% and swapping out the simcard from my old Pixel 2 I went to activating the 5.

Upon booting it gives me the language screen, then select wifi, all fine.
Then it comes to "copy apps and data". So far I've tried both ways, via connecting my old Pixel 2 and copying using the "can't use old phone".
Both options ultimate result in the screen saying:
"Verify PIN, your phone was reset to factory settings. To use this phone, enter your previous PIN"
Now obviously I've tried my old PIN from pixel 2, and even the obvious 0000 and 1234, but none work.

The option to use my google account on the Verify PIN screen also keeps looping me into saying: "Please sign in using one of the owner's accounts"

From what I've been able to gather on the internet and around here, it seems that Factory Reset Protection has been triggered for some unknown reason. Now obviously the phone is brand new so there shouldn't be any accounts associated with this phone.

If anyone knows how to get around, please do let me know as I've tried everything I could think off besides returning the phone.

Thanks!

title: Pixel 4A Face Unlock
content:
Pixel 4A should have face unlock. Many devices are having face unlock. Even though it's not as secure it should be there as an option. It doesn't have infrared sensor so can't work in dark but it's not necessary. It should not work with eyes closed. It should be using the camera only for face unlock as many devices are doing it. As it has only a camera in front on top it should be capable.

It used to be there in older versions of android hidden in setting under smart lock and you could set up trusted face. Google needs to add back face unlock in the latest version of android and there should be an option to tick directly skip lockscreen or stay on lockscreen.

title: Haptic feedback always on, if a service in accessibility is activated

I think they should fix it, so that it always turn off battery saver.

title: Notifications still buzz when default sound is set to "None"
content:

1. Hit up or down on the volume rocker and put into vibrate mode
2. Go to Settings --> Sound --> Advanced --> Default notification sound. Choose 'None' from 'My Sounds' group.

Observed: Apps like Gmail and Outlook will continue to vibrate the device on newly incoming notifications, even though these notifications do not have 'Vibrate' enabled

Expected: Nothing should vibrate since the default notification sound is set to 'None' and the specific notifications are not set to 'Vibrate'.

title: Pixel wired earbuds wont work on lock screen
content:
update***  I even tried just doing away with a lock screen and set it so I dont have a pin and the pixel wired headset still doesn't call the google assistant when the screen is displaying the clock.  I long press the middle button and nothing happens. If I take the phone out of my pocket swipe up so my phone is on then I can long press and the assistant appears.   I give up. If anyone knows of a phone and a wired headset that can just send a text while the phone is locked or the screen is off please let me know. I'm done with the pixels.  I ride a bicycle and this is pretty much the only thing I use a phone for.  I don't need to deal with pulling my bicycle off to the side every time someone sends me a text just so I can respond. 

My assistant doesn't work on the lock screen. I am using the forums to walk through a solution but every "community expert's" advice is wrong.  The people who reply actually use the correct steps which is very helpful. This is so frustrating it reminds me of when I used to own an iphone and wanted to change one little thing and had to spend hours only to hit a dead end bc they lock everything down which was the reason I switched to android.  The ironic thing is when I used the iphone assistant to text it was amazing and worked 100% of the time with no lag.  Here I am with pixel 3 and a pixel 4a and can no longer use a simple feature like that.  All I want to do is click my middle WIRED headset button so the google assistant appears and I can say "text so and so".  
 Have you confirmed that the "Allow responses while phone is locked" option is enabled? You can find this at Settings > Apps & notifications > Assistant > See all Assistant settings > Assistant (tab) > Pixel USB-C earbuds > Allow responses while phone is locked.
 I found this in one of the forums but when I go to settings, apps, assistant, see all assistant settings then there is NO assistant (tab) there is a long list of every single option except assistant tab. I just need to find where I can click allow responses while phone is locked for Pixel USB C earbuds because I have followed the other 97 steps just so I can try to send a hands free voice text while my phone is locked. This is ridiculous.  I have already clicked turned on locked screen personal results and I have already turned on allow wired headset request with device locked and the button to call google assistant still doesnt work on lockscreen. It immediately works if I take the phone out of my pocket unlock the phone and then press it but by then what is the use of having a button to call google assistant if I have to go through all of the steps manually on the phone anyway.

title: How to change the default account for new contacts and new events?
content:
Hello all,

I am a happy user of Android 11 on a Pixel 3a. I decided to host my contacts and my calendar events on my own Nextcloud server using the davx5 (CalDAV/CardDAV provider for Android).

So:

- I deleted all my contacts on https://contacts.google.com/

- I deleted my events and calendars on https://calendar.google.com/calendar. Unfortunately, it is impossible to delete the "Reminders", "Tasks", and my name calendars (I imagine these are default mandatory calendars)

- I synced with my Android

- I disabled the sync of "Calendar", "Contacts" and "Tasks in Calendar" for my google account in the "Accounts" settings

Now, my Android is clean from any google contact or event. But when I create a new contact or a new event, they are added to my google account by default... So I need to be careful to chose the davx5 account each time.

So my question is simple; how can set my davx5 as the default account for my new contacts or events?

Thanks for any help!
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 3a

title: Do not disturb override not working for Google Calendar App

title: Always On Display never turns off !
content:
In Settings \ Display : Advanced \ Lock screen \ WHEN TO SHOW : Idle lock screen

I have 'On when you're nearby' set, which, in the past has been working as expected. The screen would go blank after a few seconds of no movement after pressing the power button ( I also have 'Reach to check phone' on).

Now, after updating to Android 11 this no longer works. What happens is when I press the power button the screen is blank briefly then the  AOD appears and never disappears after that. Also, I have noticed that if I reach for the phone or touch the phone the lock icon appears then a few seconds later it disappears and the screen dims (AOD still on) then after approx 3 seconds the AOD briefly turns off then on again like it is trying to go blank (no AOD) but cannot. No matter how long I leave the phone the AOD is always on. Under battery usage 'Ambient display' tops the list.

When using the new Bedtime mode (Android 11) [I have the beta version installed as this has contains the 'Keep the screen dark' option] I have the option 'Keep the screen dark' set to ON. This works. After I press the power button my screen is blank,  AOD is shown. Now when I reach for the phone AOD turns on.

So it seems the option  'Reach to check phone' is broken and not working when Bedtime mode is not active.

Anyone experiencing these issues?

title: Has google figured out the obvious issue they have with software clashes on pixel phones yet?
content:
Well here goes , long story cut short. Since the day i setup up my pixel 3a it has had soft and hardware issues.  Could be multiple issues but i have identified a few and realise a new one that is causing problems. Google play music since day one seems to notify me it trying to update.  I don't use it and have not for years. Had one song one it.  But seeing as they are phasing it out and starting YouTube music.  Why have they bothered to preinstalled it on my device. Issues got worse when i opted to enjoy a free 6 month trial with apple music offered by my network provider.  Honestly i don't think the apple music app does well on a pixel anyway. But it has affected hardware mainly volume of music and various other software issue. issues. But last night i decided to access Google dashboard to try and wipe permanently the play list it claim i have in play music account that are not.  It offered to transfer them to yt music so i though go for it.  What is did was transfer playlists i had set up in apple music. So clearly a clash between and Google play music and yt music app issues. And now all those playlist are on yt music . With the one song i had in Google account. But yt music app setting are now clashing in the triangle of google play music, apple music and yt music app.   I am finding the yt music web page has amazing play back volume through chrome of all browsers, but absolute shockingly low and the equaliser settings seem to be like a petulant toddler that change themselves or do not change at all in the app. This has had a profound affect on my device and has definitely caused it to  suffer before its time .  So how do i get them to accept this and get a replacement that has not suffered the strain due to Google not thinking this through.   40gb data plan a month and i ain't using more than 12% because i just have given up with my phone.     It really has not helped with all the ways Google back up you data in various ways as you can not getting it clear enough. Device personalisation services just another spanner in the works that pushes the issue even after factory reset.   Feel so let down as i have been an android user since htc first released smart phones . Now Google the creator of android have come so far and messed up spectacularly.  And honestly i really hope i am right about this because if not then not only have they left use with a worse os than year gone by but clearly are producing poor quality hardware.  I am one of thousands having similar issues. This is not a user issue, but a google problem 😥


P.s. they also have the nerve to call this a community but yet i can not comment on others questions that are having the similar issues. Why, because they do not want users communicating and figuring out between us that they are at fault.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 3a

title: Gesture Navigation Active Apps Swipe-up Not Reliably Working, Android 11
content:
I am using gesture navigation (not two or three button), and since I switched to Android 11 I have noticed that the active apps carousel does not reliably work. When I slow/partial pull up from the bottom edge of the screen while in an app, it simply returns to my home screen (rather than showing the active apps). While I am on the home screen and pull up, nothing happens (which is correct with no apps open, but I know that several are open). The normal procedure for viewing all apps (pull up from the middle of the home screen) works fine. Restarting my phone seems to fix the issue, but I would prefer it not to be a problem in the first place.
I used gesture navigation with Android 10 and it always worked smoothly. I noticed the slight change in how gesture navigation works between the two Android versions (personally, I liked the 10 version better) but this issue is not that.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 3a

title: Restore on Pixel 4a from Pixel 2 XL did not include SMS/MMS
content:
My Pixel 2 XL (with Android 11) lost its ability to charge over the weekend. I just got a Pixel 4a. I powered on the P2XL and did a full backup. I then started the P4a setup and was unable to use the cable to transfer data (probably for the same reason I could no longer charge the P2XL) so I had to do a restore from the cloud (Google Drive). It reported no errors. I noticed none of my SMS or MSM were on the new phone so I ended up having to boot up the old phone again and install a 3rd party app to do a backup, and then retore it onto the new phone. I'm down to 15% left on the old phone, I hope this is the last of whatever I need to do!

Just putting this out there so it can be on record as I noticed others reporting a similar issue.

title: Maps PIP, when using 2-button nav doesn't work with direct app changes
content:
So I have this dilema: I prefer 3-button nav, but with the recent Android 11 decision to remove frequently used app suggestions I had to change to 2-button nav. The big problem is that I use Google Maps Picture-In-Picture (PIP) daily and for hours, but when I switch to another app PIP does not automatically happen like it does when I use 3-button nav. I am forced to press home button to get to the home (secondary or tertiary) screen, in which PIP occurs then I an switch to a different app to keep PIP. I frequently forget to go to the home screen as I'm used to quickly switching between apps. Is there some setting that allows for PIP to always automatically happen when I leave the maps app?

With 3 button I can: Select navigation in Maps, tap recents button and PIP pops up, then swipe to another app (since I can't select a frequently used app in the bottom 5 row that used to exist and was poorly removed), PIP stays throughout.
With 2 button I have to: Select navigation in Maps, tap home button and PIP pops up, gesture swipe up to access frequently used apps, then select an app.
The extra step is very inconvenient.

This may all be moot though since Pixel 5 has a decreased chipset and I'm now eying Oneplus and may go back to Nova launcher.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 2

title: Error "Cannot interpret QR code" in "Transfer accounts". How do I transfer my codes all at once?
content:
I have a new Pixel 4a and an LG G6 both with version 5.10 of Authenticator.

On the LG G6 I tap the three dots in the upper right hand corner and tap Transfer accounts. I then am able to tap Export accounts, and I enter my pin. With all the checks selected I tap Next and am given 2 QR codes.

On the Pixel 4a I tap Get Started and tap "Import existing accounts?" at the bottom right of the screen(although tapping "Scan a QR code" brings me to the same cross hairs that end in the same result). I tap "Scan QR code" and line up the phones. 

The Pixel 4a vibrates and scans the first QR code and I tap "Next" on the LG G6 to get the second QR code. The Pixel 4a  vibrates again and shows a shield and message that says "Error", "Cannot interpret QR code". And the only option is to tap "Okay". That takes me back to where I would tap the three dots.

I have tried multiple brightness's on the LG G6 which has a really good resolution(ppi) with no cracks in the screen, and even took the screen protector off thinking that might be the problem. I know the pixel 4a has a good camera so that can't be the problem. I have more than a dozen code that I need to transfer so I'd like to not have to do them one by one.

Why isn't this working?
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 4a

title: How to upgrade Android on new Pixel before copying everything from old Pixel?
content:
I received a replacement for my Pixel 3 and copied all settings / data from old Pixel 3 to the new one (using cable method) and followed all prompts and waited until the new phone set-up was complete.

Sadly though, some of the apps were missing on the new phone, some settings were wrong too and my wallpaper / display settings were incorrect (all set to defaults).

I then realised my old phone was on Android 11 and the new replacement I'd received was on Android 10.

So I upgraded new phone to Android 11, then did a Factory Reset,  then went through the entire set-up process again and this time all apps / settings and wallpaper were copied over fine.

It would be cool if the set-up process detected the Android mismatch and gave an option to upgrade Android on the new phone BEFORE set-up does its stuff...... but meanwhile, as a suggestion.....

Perhaps you could amend your help pages (e.g. https://support.google.com/android/answer/6193424 ) to.....

describe how to ensure new phone Android version is greater than or equal to Android version on old phone BEFORE starting set-up, then (if needed)
describe how to exit set-up and do Android upgrade beforehand

Might save some confusion and having to run set-up twice.

Cheers all
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 3

title: I want to cancel the snooze of notifications.
content:
I am Japanese.
Translated by Google Translate.

Pixel 4, Android 11

 I want to cancel the snooze of notifications.

 As a result of various investigations, there seems to be no way to cancel snooze, but I will ask a question with a single hope.

 As a background, you can delete the fixed notification (notification that can not be deleted even if you swipe) with the application called FilterBox, but at that time, a warning message saying "If you delete the fixed notification, it can not be displayed again" appears.  However, if you forcibly turn it off, the notification will not be displayed again even if you restart the main unit according to the warning text.

 At this time,
 Settings> Apps & notifications> Notifications> Notification history
 If you check, the notification has been added to the snooze item.

 Originally, snooze will be canceled after the specified time has passed, but it seems that it will be registered as indefinite snooze by FilterBox.

 Here, I thought that if I could cancel the snooze, I could cancel the indefinite snooze registered by FilterBox.

 However, I searched for a way to remove snooze, but I couldn't find a way to do so, so I asked for your opinion.

 Thank you.

title: Duplicates or loss of location info when transferring photos on Android 11
content:
Hi Everyone, 

We’re aware of issues of duplicates and location info lost when setting up your Pixel phone running Android 11 and transferring your Google Photos content using a cable. We’re working quickly to resolve this, and expect this to be resolved shortly. 

To troubleshoot this issue in the meantime, please follow these steps:

If you have duplicate content in your Google Photos account and have already set up your new Pixel phone:
Go to https://photos.google.com in a web browser.
Click in the search field and select “Recently added” from the bottom of the list.
Duplicate copies (the copies without location info) will be grouped at the top 
Select the duplicate photos or videos without location info and delete them. If you’re unsure, open an individual photo and click the info (i) button. The location, if present, will appear on the bottom right of the screen.

Note: Deleted content will remain in your Trash for 60 days.

If you have not yet set up your new Pixel phone, or if you are able to factory reset your new phone before starting over:
On your old phone, install the Google Photos app from the Play Store, if you don’t have it already.
Open Google Photos and enable “Backup & sync” when prompted.
Wait for backup to complete. You may need to be on a WiFi network.
Set up your new Pixel phone as you would normally, connecting the cable. When you see the “Choose what to copy” screen, unselect photos & videos.
Complete setup. The other items will copy over.
Once setup completes, open Google Photos and confirm your photos are there.


Thanks,
The Google Pixel team
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device

title: Ringtone file isn't converted to ogg
content:
When I put .mp3 ringtone files in the Ringtones folder, they appear in My Sounds in Settings, and if I select them they play and they show up under Ringtone in the Settings/Sounds dialog. All should be well. However, they don't work when I get calls.

I discovered that all ringtones selected from the ones that came with the phone are converted to .ogg files after selecting and appear in the folder Android/media/com.google.android.soundpicker/Ringtones with the form sound_picker_track_239.ogg (with different numbers for different ringtones). However, custom ones that I add are not converted to .ogg files and put there. I have tried .mp3, .wav, and even .ogg files. They continue to show up in the My Sounds category in the Ringtones picker, but the phone isn't converting them to a usable .ogg file and placing them in the soundpicker folder. 

One of the ringtones I tried was downloaded from the web several years ago and used since then on other phones. When that one wouldn't work, I found the same one from another source and downloaded and tried it, but that file wouldn't work either.

So something is keeping Pixel from converting these custom files to .ogg format and placing them in the appropriate folder. Any ideas why or what I might do to force it to work?
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 2

title: Pixel Stand overrides chosen alarm sounds
content:
I put my Pixel 3 on a Pixel Stand at night, and I use this as an alarm to wake me up in the morning. Generally I set two alarms, about 15 minutes apart, because sometimes I press snooze or sometimes I just turn off the first one. I've set both of the alarms with sounds that are distinctly alarms, but not jarring. Recently, the first alarm is fine but when the second alarm (or snoozed alarm) goes off, the sound is a super annoying, blaring sound that is not the sound I chose. It wakes me up, but it also ruins my morning because I wake up feeling pissed off! I tried resetting the sounds, reordering the alarms, etc. It still does it. I tested the alarms when the phone wasn't docked on the Stand, and the alarms sounded with the sounds I chose, so now I think it's something the Stand is doing, but I don't see any settings that would cause it to do this. (I did, however, see 3 versions of the Stand settings, some of which were contradictory, so I deleted 2 of them). 

I'm using the Google Clock app, and I thought about uninstalling it and trying something else, but a) I'm not convinced that will help and b) most of the other alarm apps out there seem to be designed to be MORE annoying.

Any suggestions? I love the Stand as a wireless charging device, but if I can't figure out a way to fix this, I'm going to have to stop using it overnight.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 3

title: How do I get downloaded MP3 ringtone to work as ringtone on Pixel 3a (nothing helps!)?
content:
The ringtone (from site MyTinyPhone) is on the phone, in the default Ringtones folder; however, it can only be seen there when the Ringtones folder is reached via Settings-->Storage-->Files or the My Files app. And it will only play as an audio file, never as a ringtone.

If I use Settings-->Sound and go to "Phone ringtone", the number "20" is shown; if I click that, I get a screen that says "No data" and has "MyTinyPhone" across the top.

I've already tried various things, including installing the My Files app (which enabled me to move the ringtone from the MyTinyPhone folder to the default Ringtones folder) and downloading the ringtone to my PC & copying it to my phone's Ringtones folder, but nothing seems to help.

I've also contacted my provider (Tello/Sprint) to find out if they block downloaded songs from being used as ringtones at all, but this doesn't appear to be the case.

About the only change I've seen is that the ringtone's title appeared initially under "Phone ringtone" Sound, but has now been replaced by "20". Also, the name of the ringtone file itself differs slightly between the one downloaded directly to my phone & the one downloaded to my PC (but that's probably irrelevant).

I've spent literally hours and hours on this, with nothing to show for it so far. I'm at my wit's end!

Can someone please let me know how to get this ringtone to work as a ringtone on my Pixel 3a?

title: How to tune new Pixel Buds for higher frequencies?
content:
I can't seem to get Google support for my new Google Pixel Buds?

Google's app, Sound Amplifier, has an email address on the Play store
for support.  That email address does not work!   The reply I got was:
"You have emailed to an address that is no longer being monitored.
To get help, please visit https://support.google.com/."
However, Support does not know how to address these issues.

Today I just got a new pair of Google Pixel Buds from Google, to use with my Pixel 3 XL Android.

At my age of 79, it is common for high frequencies to drop, so I was hoping that the new Pixel Buds together with my Pixel 3 XL might help "punch up" these frequencies.  I have already tried  your using Google Sound Amplifier Sound and the Accessibility options (including the Google  Accessibility Scanner), but they only provide a sketch of how I might modify sounds?

I also am trying the Bass Booster Pro  app, and I would like feedback on the settings, to see if I am reasonably addressing my problem on both apps?  Google support recommended that I add an equalizer app to Sound Amplifier?

The basic problem is that although Sound Amplifier has a setting for "Sound around you", this does not work very well at all and all sounds are muffled by the buds.

I also have tinnitus which I know makes it more difficult to address these issues.

If I can't get support, I'll just return the buds.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 3 XL

title: I cannot change or add ANY custom notification sounds in Android 10 on my Pixel 3
content:
Title says it all. Please note that before I updated to Android 10, this worked just fine with the exact same custom tones.
Pixel 3, Android 10, latest security/Play patches, all apps up to date

I already know how to make and add my own ringtones and notification tones, have been doing it on every Android phone I've ever owned going back to my Moto Droid. Adding custom ringtones works fine, but I cannot change a single notification tone (Messages, GMail, etc.) away from the default; even the builtin sounds don't work, only the single default one (which is Popcorn on my phone).

I can create and add custom notification tones to the phone itself, and they even show up under "My Sounds" when going to change the tone, but when I tap on the new sound, nothing plays (should play a preview of the tone). Moreover, if select any of the builtin Google tones, same result: no sound. If I tap back to the default, it plays the preview sound. If I leave it set to my custom sound (or another builtin that isn't the default), I simply get nothing when that particular notification comes in. I tested this in Messages, GMail, Outlook, and Discord, so it is also not specific to only GApps.

It seems like the issue is with the new Notification system in Android 10.

What I've already tried:
Factory reset, whereby I immediately tested this before restoring anything, so none of my apps can possibly be causing this. This should have fixed if it was an issue I caused; this points me towards Android 10 itself as the culprit
Prior to my factory reset, I tried the following:
I've tried .mp3, .ogg, .flac, and .m4a formats for the custom tones, all the same result
I cleared all cache/data of every app I could think of (Messages, GMail, Sounds, etc.)

Any help is greatly appreciated....having custom notification sounds for the different apps has always been one of my favorite things about Android, and now that every app has the same notification sound...ugh.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 3

I had to perform a factory reset on my phone due to a system malfunction which rendered my phone unusable. This happened a few weeks ago and I was able to restore my phone completely to how it was before.
   However this time I went through the same process: logged into my account and selected the most recent Google Drive backup from a few days ago to restore. Except this time round there's lot of things missing. My home screen has returned to the default one, all my SMS are gone and a lot of my settings preferences are gone too. 
  This is intensely frustrating as I can see the backup I wanted still saved on the drive but i can't restore it properly. I've already reset it again and tried to go through the process again of restoring it but with the same results. Any help would be appreciated

The most basic backup and restore systems allow users to control this stuff.  Not Google!  All of the videos and tech notes from Google do not show how this is accomplished, yet, they constantly harangue users in the apps to backup to google cloud.  What's the point if you can't get that data back onto the phone?

title: Is there a way to recover a past device backup?
content:
Last week I managed to crack a screen so bad it required me to send it in for repair. Before sending it in I performed (what I thought) to be a backup and factory reset my device. I send it in, and get a new device backup today. It is not the same device as I sent in. I go through the normal activation with my old SIM and run into a couple of issues that required me to call Verizon support. Currently the tech thinks my device has not been made available to the Verizon database as acceptable (though it shows it is Verizon enabled). I don't know that this is related. I can't connect to 4G/LTE or wifi yet.

The problem lies with the backup I thought I created. It is not available in my backup list, only my Chromebook. From what I have gathered the backup should be there. Even if it weren't the most recent I should still see one, right? Does the factory reset affect this? The new device? The lack of actual wifi set up? I had a recovery email set up but I don't think that's where my backup was located. I'm just truly lost. The whole point, to me, of a backup is to keep it there. A Google rep on chat indicated that the backup may expire which is 2 weeks. It's already been one. What else can I do? I set a backup to be able to recover everything and when I delete my device via factory reset it deleted the backup?? That's not the point! 

Happy to provide whatever info I can.

title: Pixel 2: Notification Volume DURING CALLS
content:
First, let me say that I understand how to access the four volume sliders for Media Volume, Call Volume, Ring Volume and Alarm Volume, and I understand that in current versions of Android, "Ring Volume" controls volume for both incoming call rings and notifications.  I also understand that many people have complaints about that coupling, and have adapted settings on the DND feature as workarounds for their issues.

In my case though, DND customization won't help.  I do want to be able to hear my ringer and notification sounds at all times.  Currently, I'm very happy with the volume when the phone is in my pocket, sitting next to me, on the other side of the room ... wherever.  It's fine, it's great, it's set at a little over 1/3.

BUT ... when I'm ON a call and have the phone against my ear, the notification alerts come in at SUCH a high volume that I'm constantly yanking the phone away from my head and yelping in pain.  Sometimes a series of e-mails or messages will come through while I'm on a call, and my ears are literally left ringing afterwards.  This is going to cause long-term damage.

I do need to be able to have audible alerts while I'm on a call -- no, I don't want to use DND to completely silence them, and no, I don't want my phone constantly vibrating while I'm on a call.

There are tons of volume control apps out there, but I haven't found any that will help me.  Does anyone know of an app that will let me customize in-call notification volume without also changing the standard notification volume for when I'm NOT on a call?

Appreciate any tips or suggestions!  Thanks everyone.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 2

title: My backup exists in Drive for 4XL, but after factory reset phone does not see the backup to restore
content:
Hello. On April 7 I did a factory reset of my 4XL. Phone has never been in any betas. I checked the Settings->Advanced->Backups before the reset and it showed that my phone backed up device settings, sms, call logs, and the app settings. 

When I try to restore, the only backup the 4XL sees is an old Chromebook I have. It does not see the 4XL that I backed up. That said, I have backed up and restored this phone successfully in January.

I had the exact same problem with my 2XL back last fall. That 2XL had been on a beta (I did unenroll the device), but I figured that restore might have been still affected by the beta. I am concerned now as my 4XL which was set up as a fresh new device when I purchased it, is now having the same issue. I am paying for Google One additional support and space.

I contacted Google 1:1 support 2 days ago and all they would do is tell me that if my device was backed up I could restore. At the time the tech told me that I could no longer see Pixel backups in Drive because that functionality was removed. I learned since that this is not true, and I can clearly see the backup in my Google Drive that the 4XL could not see. 

I asked for this to be escalated and I am waiting still. I also asked for my case to be escalated last fall and I got no response at that time either.

Is there anything else I can check for these backups? I was smart this time and backed up my texts via 3rd party, but I still had to manually reinstall the 120 apps I have, as well as set up device settings. The Google support tech also suggested that I use a 3rd party backup solution.

Also, what do folks do when Google support does not get back to you? I have not had much luck getting accurate information or promised followups. Thanks!
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 4 XL

title: How to stop Play Store from crashing within 30 seconds of opening?
content:
Hi, I have upgraded (OTA) my Pixel 2 from Android 9 to Android 10. When I now launch the Play Store, it comes up and crashes within 30 seconds. Sometimes it gets to "Download Pending", sometimes to "Downloading", but never actually started a download. This means I can not install and update Apps now.

I have tried cleaning the cache and data of both Play Store as Play Store Services. Have tried Safe Mode. Have uninstalled Play Store and Play Store Services updates. All to no avail. When looking at the process list, it appears that the underlying Play Store Service process suddenly dies. All permissions are enabled.

Anything else that I can try. I am afraid of doing a factory reset. Besides the extra work re-instating something that I already have, what if that does not fix the Play Store issue. That would mean that I can no longer use my phone.

Any pointers/ideas are appreciated.

I am a massive Android and Pixel fan since the very beginning. Never had a problem. Sad to see so many Pixel upgrade issues. Must have been a very rushed release in the end. 

Thank you.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 2

title: Google Refurbished Pixel 2 is Always Defective (bootloader unlock)
content:
There is an obscure feature that few phone makers other than Google include in their phones. According to the internet forums and my personal experience so far, this feature is broken in most of the warranty replacement phones shipped by Google. Nobody but Google can repair it. Because of its obscurity and technical nature, few support personnel are understanding or sympathetic. I think there may be some kind of bureaucratic disconnect that is preventing this issue from being addressed, or Google has decided the number of affected users is too small to be worth the resources needed to fix the flaw in their refurbishment process. The name of the feature is "unlockable bootloader".

Google has shipped me 2 broken phones so far in their attempt to remedy an unrelated defect in my original Pixel 2. I just finished the phone call to have the second replacement exchanged for a third replacement. Both times the support technician has in the end told me that there's nothing they are allowed to do for me other than fill out an order form for another refurbished phone and leave a comment in the order for the fulfillment team to read. Requesting an unlockable bootloader in the comment didn't work the first time and, based on the forum posts I've seen, I have my doubts that it will ever change anything.

I don't know what else to do, so I intend to keep sending them in for a replacement until I receive one that isn't broken.

For community reference, I can see on the RMA information that the refurbishment is being handled by an external company, "Cynergy". A quick web search shows that this is probably their website: http://www.cynergyus.com/. Anyone else interested in devices with unlockable bootloaders should probably be wary of manufacturers that partner with Cynergy.

Technical log:
--------------------------------------------------------------

C:\Program Files (x86)\Android\android-sdk\platform-tools>fastboot flashing get_unlock_ability
                                                   (bootloader) get_unlock_ability: 1
OKAY [  0.001s]
Finished. Total time: 0.003s

C:\Program Files (x86)\Android\android-sdk\platform-tools>fastboot flashing unlock
                                                   FAILED (remote: 'Flashing Unlock is not allowed
')
fastboot: error: Command failed

Steps to reproduce:
--------------------------------------------------------------

1. Acquire a refurbished Google Pixel 2. (GA00126-US-RA)

2. Power it on without inserting a SIM card and skip everything in the initial setup.

3. Unlock the secret "Developer options" by tapping 7 times on "Build number" in the "About phone" settings page.

4. Enter the "System" settings page, enter the "Developer options" sub-page, and find the "OEM unlocking" setting near the top.

5. Because OEM unlocking is greyed out and says "Connect to the internet or contact your carrier", connect the phone to a Wi-Fi. (Set the connection to "metered" while adding the Wi-Fi to prevent it from wastefully downloading updates.)

6. After some time, reopen developer options and enable OEM unlocking. (Note: I have found that the setting of this slider and the state of get_unlock_ability persists across factory resets. At this step after doing a factory reset, you will find the slider is already enabled from the last time. The setting being greyed out or not does not affect get_unlock_ability.)

7. Completely shut down the device by holding the power button for a few seconds and selecting "Power off".

https://source.android.com/setup/build/running#booting-into-fastboot-mode

8. Enter fastboot mode: "Press and hold Volume Down, then press and hold Power." Let go of the power button once the phone vibrates but keep holding the volume button. (If you continue holding the power button you will accidentally trigger the "Start" command from the fastboot menu.)

9. Connect the device to a PC with "Android SDK" and "Google USB Driver" installed.

10. Open Command Prompt on the PC.

11. Run a command to navigate to the SDK platform tools folder: cd /d "C:\Program Files (x86)\Android\android-sdk\platform-tools"

12. Run the command to verify that you have enabled OEM unlocking: fastboot flashing get_unlock_ability

Command response should be: (bootloader) get_unlock_ability: 1
If it responds "get_unlock_ability: 0" then OEM unlocking was not enabled properly at step 6.

13. Run the command to unlock the bootloader: fastboot flashing unlock

Instead of initiating the bootloader unlock process on the phone screen, command response is: FAILED (remote: 'Flashing Unlock is not allowed')

If you boot back to the normal system at this point, you will find the "OEM unlocking" slider is greyed out again no matter what the internet state is. get_unlock_ability is still 1. It can only be un-greyed by doing a factory reset and starting over from step 1, but you will find at step 6 that it is already enabled. Disabling, rebooting, and enabling again does not help.


Further reading:
--------------------------------------------------------------

RMA phone from Google is not unlocking the bootloader
https://forum.xda-developers.com/pixel-2/help/rma-phone-google-unlocking-bootloader-t3937931

OEM Unlocking Grayed out on non-VZW Pixel 2.
https://forum.xda-developers.com/pixel-2/help/oem-unlocking-grayed-vzw-pixel-2-t3776763

PSA: RMA refurbished Pixel 2's can NOT be bootloader unlocked.
https://www.reddit.com/r/Android/comments/9xcdle/psa_rma_refurbished_pixel_2s_can_not_be/

Cannot unlock Pixel 2 bootloader
https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/73217322

Web Search: "get_unlock_ability: 1" "Flashing Unlock is not allowed"
https://www.google.com/search?q="get_unlock_ability%3A+1"+"Flashing+Unlock+is+not+allowed"

(Unrelated bug: This message board does not support links ending in a quote mark, even if you manually set the link target in the editor.)

title: [FIXED] Alarms not going off on your Pixel 3 under Android 10? Ways to fix it!
content:
Are you going nuts with random alarms not going off? You are sure you set it, you don't remember turning it off, and suddenly you're half an hour late?

Found the solution for me.  The Pixel has a 'flip to shh' setting in do not disturb, which sets it to DND when it is flipped downward.  I had disabled alarms in do not disturb.

This is located by long pressing the do not disturb button.  Then either enable alarms, or disable the flip to shh setting in 'schedules'.  Which is very non-intuitive.

Or just keep your pixel face up to have alarms go off., and still be able to set a DND while watching a movie.

(I had reset the app in safe mode, installed three different ones, check that it wasn't on blocked notifications, etc. Posting it a lot of places for visibility. Lots of people having this problem of a feature they forgot about.)
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 3 XL

title: How to manage notification sounds on an App by App basis? (e.x. block all sounds except Spotify)
content:
General problem: 
I want to block all notification sounds from ALL APPS EXCEPT for the "business-related" ones. Do not Disturb does not allow me to do this. I have to choose between all  sounds or no sounds.  
What I'd like is a white-list.  Is there an app to do this (or an Android way to do it)?

It used to work on Android 8.1 and earlier: 
Android 8.1 and earlier had a feature that went along with "Do not Disturb" called "priority only allows" and it is described in the "Do not disturb" help pages.  This allowed you to allow apps through the do not disturb sound barrier. However I am on a newer version of Android and I can no longer use this feature. 
This was a whitelisting feature I would like on the latest version of Android. 

it's been a few years and I am fed up with having to choose between being distracted all day and missing important messages and phone calls. 

Specific problems: 
1. Do not disturb blocks my Google Play music songs.. I can choose to "allow media sounds" but I have to choose between allowing ALL sounds and NO sounds at all. 
I would like my music to play but I would not like web-pages with popup videos I am viewing to blare out at max volume in a quiet office. 
Do not Disturb in its modern form blocks either "all messaging app notifications" or "no messaging app notifications." 
What if I want to receive notifications for the (text) "messages" app but not facebook messenger and whatsapp?
(Messages is for business, whatsapp is for family and friends). 
I am aware that you can manage sounds for notifications in the App settings, but I have 141 apps on my phone (and am deleting a bunch now so that I don't have to manage their sounds). I cannot go through each one and disable notification sounds one by one and modify them, especially because each app has a different notification options menu. 
Can the default for all new apps be changed to "no notification sounds!!??" - How? 
 Is there any way to manage a whitelist instead of a blacklist?
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 3

title: Dark Mode no longer working on Gmail app, Theme settings gone

Today, my Gmail app suddenly no longer appears in dark mode. I tried to change the settings but the theme options/options to change Gmail to dark mode is no longer showing up in the app settings. I force stopped the app and it didn't work. I uninstalled updates, reinstalled updates, and it still doesn't work/show dark mode option.

I restarted my phone, still nothing. I turned dark mode on/off on my phone and still nothing. 

I don't understand why Gmail stopped appearing in dark mode, why the option to turn on dark mode is no longer available in-app, and why it won't go dark even though my phone settings are set to dark mode. This happened from one to day to another and makes absolutely no sense. 

Screenshot attached showing my Gmail settings and how theme/dark mode is no longer there.

title: My Google Pixel 2 is in Factory Reset Protection mode, I've exhausted all my steps to recover it.
content:
First and foremost, the Pixel 2 is definitely mine, I still have receipt on my google account.

When I stopped using my Pixel 2 and got a new phone, I factory reset it, and somewhere down the line, I created a brand new account on it but never inserted a sim into the phone.

And now, a year later, I've offered to give my Pixel 2 to a family member as I'm only using it as a paperweight. But now, I can't remember the pin nor account I was using on the phone which prompted me to reset the phone on recovery mode (simultaneously pressing volume and power button).

That proved to be a mistake as the phone is factory reset protected and still asks for the pin or google account information that was on the phone prior to my resetting.
 I've exhausted Google's customer online chat support steps, they were unable to resolve the issue.

There isn't any way to bypass FRP, or take it/send it in to a google store to be restored? I can't believe this phone would be irretrievable?
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device
