title: How do I make a persistent notification low-importance in Android 10?
content:
With Android 9, I was able to give an app's persistent notification low importance. This eliminated the the icon in the notification bar and made the notification a single line. When I upgraded to Android 10, this setting remained the same, so I know that apps can have low importance settings in Android 10. 

Now I have a new phone and installed the app, but cannot find the setting to make it's persistent notification  low importance. I can make it silent, but the icon remains in the notification bar and the notification itself is several lines long.

The persistent Google weather and maps notifications are low importance -- they do not have an icon and they are one line tall. How do I give another app that setting?

Thanks for your help,

-- Tim

title: Want to put your own mp3's on a pixel 3 but having issues? Try this!
content:
I found some articles that suggested the the ringtone had to be both in the Pixel 3a/Ringtones folder and the Pixel 3a/Android/media/com.google.android/Ringtones folders.  My phone does not have a com.google.android folder, instead it has a com.google.android.soundpicker folder.  
Working off the theory that the underlying issue is the Sounds app is not playing nicely with the native Android setup, I decided to try manually adding a Ringtones folder in the Pixel 3a/Android/media directory, and placing the file both there and in the "official" Ringtones folder, then restart the phone, and that got it to work.

I suspect there was a release where someone updated the app but missed updating a folder path in an associated file.  Since I had tried a bunch of other stuff before adding the new folder, I was going to do some regression testing to confirm exactly where all the files needed to be, but got sidetracked.

Hope this is helpful.  Copied from Brian Hassler, buried under another post.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 3

title: Feature request: Lockdown option needs to be more configurable
content:
In the Android 10 security settings (Pixel 3) there are several Smart Lock features.
* On-body detection
* Trusted places
* Trusted devices
* Voice match

This thread is not to discuss the security effectiveness of some of these options. However, if someone wants more security, then the Smart Lock features can be disabled by using the Lockdown option from the power menu.

The Lockdown feature also applies to the fingerprint reader. But I don't want to be conscious all the time of when to disable the fingerprint reader with the Lockdown option everywhere and all the time. This can be done much smarter by combining it with the Smart Lock features.

For example, I think it would be great to combine trusted places with the fingerprint reader. Thus creating e.g. the policy that a pincode is always needed to unlock the device, except for when at home or other trusted places. Such as at home, at work or at university you can then conveniently use the fingerprint reader. But not when on the go. It would also be great (for some users I suppose) to even enforce the pincode + fingerprint (or any other combination possible on a device) for extra two factor authentication at e.g. a sensitive workplace or country.

This would greatly improve Android's security smarts. Please consider combining these existing security features.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 3

title: Pixel 2 Set-Up Issues following Factory Reset
content:
My Pixel 2 abruptly got stuck on the boot loop screen after a restart. I forced several hard restarts with the same result. After running through the solutions provided in Google's support documentation, I was forced to perform a factory reset.

When setting up my device, I went through the entire set-up process (using the same owner account as before and passing the 2-Factor Authentication.) This went mostly smoothly, and I was prompted to recover old device data and Google Pay information, which was correct. On the final step of set-up, "adding finishing touches," I received a dialog that reads:

"Not Signed In.
To use this phone, you first have to sign in to the owner's Google Account in use on this phone when it was last reset.
Because you haven't done so, you have to set up the phone again."

I've repeated this several times with the same results. I've had the same primary Google Account for a decade (this one) and it's also in use on my Google Home devices which are still functioning correctly. I'm completely at a loss as to what the issue is and what I can do to solve it. I even tried setting up an additional Google Account during the set-up process with the same results.

Has anyone else had this experience? Given the weird restart issues I'm concerned it's a hardware problem and the phone may need to be replaced, which is a shame considering it's less than 2 years old.

EDIT: For some additional context, my phone is on Google Fi.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 2

title: Option to decouple volume controls?
content:
The Android OS volume controls are horribly broken. For the most part, I love stock Android.

However, the decision, starting in Pie, to couple volume controls that should not be coupled, *and* give the user no option for more advanced control, is inexcusable for a brand that has a motto of "Be together. Not the same."

Specifically: Notifications volume should be separate from Ringer volume, and System volume (taking pictures, etc.) should be separate from Ringer volume.

There are no excuses for this, and I will not be purchasing another stock Android phone if I am going to be shoehorned into crippled volume controls.

I should not have to mute the Ringer, or anything else, to mute notifications, and the same for system sounds. Period. It is a terrible design decision not to give me that option somewhere.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 3 XL

title: Screen pattern not recognized after reboot and OS update? Reset device, can't load backup?
content:
Here's an answer from someone else with the same issue.  What is this random pattern that the device changed to after factory reset? I know that the Titon security they use to encrypt our data uses this stupid screen pattern to verify.  I have my password to my account, and my fingerprint was working fine before reboot and factory data reset.  Now I have reset the phone, but can't load my backup.  And, after 10 fails with the correct pattern swipe (the same one I have used for years) you backup is gone forever. WTF?

Good info for others below..

No, there is absolutely no way to unlock the phone without knowing the correct pattern (or, in your case, the pattern that your device randomly changed to). 
 The ONLY way is to perform a Factory Data Reset, but this will result in a loss of the data. You have said that you do not want to lose data, so that is not a solution for you.
 Anyway, even if you did decide you need to Factory Reset without knowing the pattern, you would need to know the password of your Google Account in order to get back into the device (for theft security purposes).

title: Pixel 3a auto-selecting options in dialog boxes
content:
TL;DR: Phone displays permission request dialog and auto selects an option. I need to manually select these options instead of having them auto selected.

Hello all!

In using my pixel 3a, I have noticed that it will automatically select options in dialog boxes for me. For example, when an app will ask for access or permissions, the phone will select an option without me touching the screen. This happens with almost every pop-up box of that nature. ("use this app just once or always" is not affected by this). Also, if the app requests multiple permissions, only the first will be auto-selected.

I've been fine to live with the issue until now, but last night I needed to connect my phone to my laptop with bluetooth, but the phone was autoselecting the "cancel" option, and I couldn't tap "connect" fast enough. (the permission screen will display for a fraction of a second before an option is selected, so I know it appears but I cannot do anything about it). I assumed it was a setting I enabled when I set up the phone, so I reset all my app settings/permissions, but this has done nothing to help the problem.

I'm generally a pretty tech-savvy person, but this has me clueless. Any ideas, tips, anything would be very helpful. Thanks in advance!

~Andy

title: Pixel 3 Notification sounds not obeying silent and vibrate rules
content:
Hi all,

I bought a Pixel 3 about a week ago after having a Nexus 5x for years. The device is up to date with security patches and Android version.
The issue I'm having at the moment is that when I activate the "vibrate" shortcut it will silence the ringtone and set it to vibrate but notifications still play at full volume. The only way I've found to silence notifications is with Do Not Disturb mode.
I've looked pretty exhaustively through the settings menu's and think this might be a glitch as when I have the phone on vibrate mode and attempt to change the default notification sound the notification sound won't play (clearly attempting to respect volume settings) but when a notification comes through normally it plays at full volume. This leads me to think there is some decoupling of the actual call to play a notification from the sound settings at any given time.
I've searched around and can't find any threads with a similar issue so I'm not sure if this is a glitch or whether this is just some specific settings I've toggled accidentally.
Any help would be much appreciated.

title: Why is Do Not Disturb turning itself on, not following rules
content:
Over the last few days, I've noticed my Do Not Disturb is turning itself on.  I have two rules set: wind down between 11pm and 5am and also "flip to shhh".  That's it.  

My phone wasn't flipped for any of the next three situations and it wasn't between my wind down time parameters:

Two days ago, I kept missing calls between 10am and noon - only to realize that my DND was on when I didn't set it to be.  

Last night, I was at dinner about 5:30pm and kept missing texts and calls.  Sure enough, DND was on... 

This morning, phone was working fine, DND was off; then at 9:30am I noticed DND was turned on.  I turned it off.  Then at 9:35am noticed it was turned on again. I was on my phone at the time (using Facebook) and saw the upper right status bar icon populate without me prompting it to turn on. 

I've disabled DND, I've restarted my phone, I've read every thread out there already and can't find anything that matches what's happening for me.  Anyone else experiencing this?

title: Minimal customization options??
content:
i just switched from a Samsung Galaxy Note8 to the Google Pixel 3XL and I am incredibly disappointed in my decision. The Samsung gave me countless options built-in to customize not only the home screen, but the icons (more than just the shape... the entire look), the message app (including the bubble color and look), the keyboard (I HATE the Google Keyboard), and anything else I could think of.

Google Pixel gives me basically no options. Light vs dark? That's it? Really? No themes? 

And don't even get me started on the navigation bar. I actually got over the notch almost immediately. But then I noticed when certain windows are open, the navigation bar turns black, further decreasing the screen size. And there does not seem to be a way to fix this.

So. My question, to anyone, is there ANY WAY to get my phone actually customized? I've read briefly about installing launchers but even those have minimal options.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 3 XL

title: Can a Non-Admin user sign onto device without requiring the admin PIN first?
content:
I have a Pixel 2XL that I plan to provide to my daughter. I don't want her account to be the admin on the phone, I want it to be mine so that I can apply parental controls without the possibility of her disabling it. I have setup the phone as follows:

1. Logged onto the device using my google account. I then add her google account as well (because we're using google fi and can only have one line per google account, so I need her account on my admin user so the line works).
2. I go to Settings -> System -> Advanced -> Multiple Users and create a new user for my daughter, turning on phone calls & SMS as well.
3. I setup her user by signing into her google account. She has her own PIN, different from the admin account.

Switching between users, phone calls and text messages all work fine. The problem is when the phone is restarted. The phone demands I enter the "admin" user account PIN before I can do anything else. I try swiping down on the top menu, selecting the "person" icon, and I can see her user account as an option, but it's grayed out and tapping it does nothing. The only thing I can do is select the admin user and enter that PIN. After this is done, I can then switch to her user without issue.

Needless to say, my concern is if she's out and happens to restart the phone (runs out of battery, perhaps a software glitch crashes the device, whatever), that I would have to provide her the admin pin in order for her to use the phone again. This defeats the purpose of creating an account for her to begin with.

Is there any way to allow her to sign onto the device post-restart without having the admin enter a PIN first?
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 2

title: Transferring data from Pixel during setup, by cable, does not preserve wallpaper
content:
I set up a new Pixel 2, and wanted to move data from my existing Pixel 2. Both are on the latest Android OS (9, forgot to note the build). 

I've restored data between two Pixel 2s before - previously, I used the backup function on the old phone, and restored onto the new phone over wifi using the backup restore function. This preserved the wallpaper. 

This time, I restored using a USB-C cable, but it did not preserve the wallpaper.

It's a small issue, but just wanted to post for awareness.

title: How do I permanently disable the "enter your pin/password for additional security" feature?
content:
Approximately every 48 hours, my device will ask me to enter my PIN number when I attempt to unlock it with my fingerprint and give me a message on screen: "Please enter your PIN for additional security". The device has not been rebooted, this seems to be a so-called "feature" of the device.

I have looked through the device settings and security settings in particular, and I cannot find a setting to disable this so-called "feature".

It's extremely bothersome and the only alternative I can see, is to completely disable all security on my phone and have it completely unlocked!!! This is not an option I want to use.

I also do not want to use the "on body" unlocking, as that is equally unreliable. I simply want my fingerprint to be the method used to unlock it, with the option of using my PIN code as and when I chose to use it! I refuse to be FORCED into entering my PIN code every time the phone thinks I should use it.

title: Backbutton
content:
Nothing wrong. Just wanted to repost a Reddit post that I feel very strongly about. I hope that we'll keep our navigation buttons; I personally hate how iphones users have to navigate through their phones with swipes which is one of the reasons why I'll never switch.

https://www.reddit.com/r/GooglePixel/comments/as38pz/i_love_the_back_button/

If anyone from Google reads these posts: Please, for the love of all that is holy, leave the back button alone!
I just read an article that the back button might disappear from the next Android release. Personally, I don't like gesture navigation, and I'll be incredibly angry (and avoid updating) if the back button is removed. I'm a huge fan of giving people the option to choose between gesture and normal navigation, but I hope Google doesn't try to force everyone to use gestures. Sadly, it seems a lot of the more recent Android changes have been all about removing the ability to choose and customize...
Why would I ever want to have to make a sweeping gesture to do something when I can make a simple tap? The back button is a beautiful thing, and I absolutely hate using phones without it (most of my family are a bunch of quitters and have iPhones). Even if I'm in the minority, I'm sure that--at the very least--people with arthritis would agree.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel

title: [Pixel 2 Android 9] No Backups Available after Factory Reset/New Phone
content:
Hello all,

I received a new phone via RMA. I backed up my old one and checked to see the backup was listed in Google Drive. When I was setting up the new phone, it said no backups found. I finished the set up and went to update the OS all the way. There were 2 or 3 updates and reboots. Did another factory reset and it still shows no backups. 

I remember back in the day iPhones wouldn't let you use an iCloud Backup restore file if the iOS version was dramatically different. But, it would still show the restore there, but it would be grayed out and actually say "iOS version mismatch". I assume the same is true for Android? If so, it just isn't showing my backup at all.

I'm not sure where to go from here. I haven't found very many articles out there regarding this issue. Thanks in advance for any help or ideas!
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 2

title: How do I transfer my data from Google to my Pixel 2XL?
content:
My Pixel 2XL recently got stolen, I've been unable to locate it as it has been switched off and as a result, I've repurchased the same phone. I'm having trouble trying to figure out how to get the data I had on my old phone (pictures, notes, apps, etc, which I have access to online) on to my new device as I don't have my old one. I thought it would be possible to do so through Cloud when I was setting up my new phone but a message appeared that basically suggested there was nothing backed up to transfer onto my new phone, but as I said I can see and have access to everything that was on my old device via my google account. 

Can anyone make sense of what I've just described and help me? I'm not particularly tech savvy so I apologise in advance for the confusing paragraph above, in short, I'd just like to find a way to transfer the info I had on my old device on to my new one without the presence of the former.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 2
